bibl.title: A Passage to Egypt: Aesop, the Priests of Heliopolis and the Riddle of the Year (Vita Aesopi 119-120). Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: In adapting the Tale of Ahiqar for his own narrative, the author of the Vita Aesopi added many details of Egyptian local colour. The priests of Heliopolis, invited by the Pharaoh to challenge Aesop with the "riddle of the year" (chapters 119-120), are such an addition. This wealth of Egyptian topical elements indicates that the author of the Vita had close familiarity with Egyptian culture and presumably a special relationship with Egypt.
